intro: Cicerbita violifolia, commonly known as the violetleaf cicerbita, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, violet-hued leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this plant thrives in rocky or limestone soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The plant has a mild, aromatic scent and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
